nodes.name: sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor
nodes.description: Allows to visualize source code of various types with syntax highlighting, line numbers in editable and read only mode.

symbols.name: sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor
symbols.description: Allows to visualize source code of various types with syntax highlighting, line numbers in editable and read only mode. Use this control in scenarios where the user should be able to inspect and edit source code. The control currently uses the third-party code editor Ace.

properties.name: colorTheme
properties.description:
Sets the editor color theme. Possible values are:

  • default: best fitting to the current UI5 theme
  • any light theme from the list: chrome, clouds, crimson_editor, dawn, dreamweaver, eclipse, github, iplastic, solarized_light, textmate, tomorrow, xcode, kuroir, katzenmilch, sqlserver
  • any dark theme from the list: hcb, hcb_bright, hcb_blue, ambiance, chaos, clouds_midnight, dracula, cobalt, gruvbox, gob, idle_fingers, kr_theme, merbivore, merbivore_soft, mono_industrial, monokai, nord_dark, one_dark, pastel_on_dark, solarized_dark, terminal, tomorrow_night, tomorrow_night_blue, tomorrow_night_bright, tomorrow_night_eighties, twilight, vibrant_ink, github_dark

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Sets whether the code in the editor can be changed by the user.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the code editor. A minimal height of 3rem will be applied in case the height is less than 20px.

properties.name: lineNumbers
properties.description: Sets whether line numbers should be shown.

properties.name: maxLines
properties.description:
Sets whether the editor height should auto expand to a maximum number of lines. After reaching the maximum number of lines specified, the content of the CodeEditor will become scrollable.

Note: Keep in mind that the auto expand CodeEditor behavior requires the height property to be set to auto.

Since: 1.48.1.

properties.name: syntaxHints
properties.description: Sets whether to show syntax hints in the editor. Those hints are visualized as value state icons in the line numbers area. The hint text is shown in tooltip of those icons. Note: This flag is only available if line numbers are shown.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the code in the editor used for syntax highlighting. Possible types are: abap, abc, actionscript, ada, apache_conf, applescript, asciidoc, assembly_x86, autohotkey, batchfile, bro, c9search, c_cpp, cirru, clojure, cobol, coffee, coldfusion, csharp, css, curly, d, dart, diff, django, dockerfile, dot, drools, eiffel, ejs, elixir, elm, erlang, forth, fortran, ftl, gcode, gherkin, gitignore, glsl, gobstones, golang, groovy, haml, handlebars, haskell, haskell_cabal, haxe, hjson, html, html_elixir, html_ruby, ini, io, jack, jade, java, javascript, json, jsoniq, jsp, jsx, julia, kotlin, latex, lean, less, liquid, lisp, live_script, livescript, logiql, lsl, lua, luapage, lucene, makefile, markdown, mask, matlab, mavens_mate_log, maze, mel, mips_assembler, mipsassembler, mushcode, mysql, nix, nsis, objectivec, ocaml, pascal, perl, pgsql, php, plain_text, powershell, praat, prolog, properties, protobuf, python, r, razor, rdoc, rhtml, rst, ruby, rust, sass, scad, scala, scheme, scss, sh, sjs, smarty, snippets, soy_template, space, sql, sqlserver, stylus, svg, swift, swig, tcl, tex, text, textile, toml, tsx, twig, typescript, vala, vbscript, velocity, verilog, vhdl, wollok, xml, xquery, yaml, terraform, slim, redshift, red, puppet, php_laravel_blade, mixal, jssm, fsharp, edifact, csp, cssound_score, cssound_orchestra, cssound_document

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value displayed in the code editor.

properties.name: valueSelection
properties.description: Sets whether the code is automatically selected if a value is set.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new CodeEditor.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: change

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The current value of the code editor.

parameters.name: oldValue
parameters.description: The old value of the code editor.

events.description: Fired when the value has changed and the focus leaves the code editor.

events.name: liveChange

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The current value of the code editor.

parameters.name: editorEvent
parameters.description: The underlying change event of the third-party code editor.

events.description: Fired when the value is changed by user interaction - each keystroke, delete, paste, etc.

methods.name: addCustomCompleter

parameters.name: oCustomCompleter
parameters.description: Object with getCompletions method

methods.description: Defines custom completer - object implementing a getCompletions method. The method has two parameters - fnCallback method and context object. Context object provides details about oPos and sPrefix as provided by the third-party code editor.

methods.name: attachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the change event of this sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor itself.

Fired when the value has changed and the focus leaves the code editor.

methods.name: attachLiveChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the liveChange event of this sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor itself.

Fired when the value is changed by user interaction - each keystroke, delete, paste, etc.

methods.name: detachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the change event of this sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: detachLiveChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the liveChange event of this sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Control.extend.

methods.name: fireChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description: Parameters to pass along with the event

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The current value of the code editor.

parameters.name: oldValue
parameters.description: The old value of the code editor.

methods.description: Fires event change to attached listeners.

methods.name: fireLiveChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description: Parameters to pass along with the event

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The current value of the code editor.

parameters.name: editorEvent
parameters.description: The underlying change event of the third-party code editor.

methods.description: Fires event liveChange to attached listeners.

methods.name: getAceEditor

returnValue.description: the internal third-party Ace code editor instance

methods.description:
Returns the internal instance of the third-party Ace code editor.

Note: This control is based on third-party open-source software, and there might be incompatible changes introduced by the code owner in their future releases.

methods.name: getColorTheme

returnValue.description: Value of property colorTheme

methods.description:
Gets current value of property colorTheme.

Sets the editor color theme. Possible values are:

  • default: best fitting to the current UI5 theme
  • any light theme from the list: chrome, clouds, crimson_editor, dawn, dreamweaver, eclipse, github, iplastic, solarized_light, textmate, tomorrow, xcode, kuroir, katzenmilch, sqlserver
  • any dark theme from the list: hcb, hcb_bright, hcb_blue, ambiance, chaos, clouds_midnight, dracula, cobalt, gruvbox, gob, idle_fingers, kr_theme, merbivore, merbivore_soft, mono_industrial, monokai, nord_dark, one_dark, pastel_on_dark, solarized_dark, terminal, tomorrow_night, tomorrow_night_blue, tomorrow_night_bright, tomorrow_night_eighties, twilight, vibrant_ink, github_dark

Default value is "default".

methods.name: getCurrentValue

returnValue.description: Returns the current value of the code editor

methods.description: Returns the current value of the code editor

methods.name: getEditable

returnValue.description: Value of property editable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property editable.

Sets whether the code in the editor can be changed by the user.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getHeight

returnValue.description: Value of property height

methods.description:
Gets current value of property height.

The height of the code editor. A minimal height of 3rem will be applied in case the height is less than 20px.

Default value is "100%".

methods.name: getIdForLabel

returnValue.description: ID to be used for the labelFor

methods.description:
Returns the DOMNode ID to be used for the "labelFor" attribute of the label.

By default, this is the ID of the control itself.

methods.name: getInternalEditorInstance

returnValue.description: the internal third-party code editor instance

methods.description: Returns the third-party code editor instance Caution: Using the third-party code editor instance introduces a dependency to that internal editor. Future changes in the internal editor might lead to undefined behavior, so it should only be used in justified cases.
methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.121. use the public CodeEditor.prototype.getAceEditor instead.

methods.name: getLineNumbers

returnValue.description: Value of property lineNumbers

methods.description:
Gets current value of property lineNumbers.

Sets whether line numbers should be shown.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getMaxLines

returnValue.description: Value of property maxLines

methods.description:
Gets current value of property maxLines.

Sets whether the editor height should auto expand to a maximum number of lines. After reaching the maximum number of lines specified, the content of the CodeEditor will become scrollable.

Note: Keep in mind that the auto expand CodeEditor behavior requires the height property to be set to auto.

Default value is 0.

methods.name: sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor.

methods.name: getSyntaxHints

returnValue.description: Value of property syntaxHints

methods.description:
Gets current value of property syntaxHints.

Sets whether to show syntax hints in the editor. Those hints are visualized as value state icons in the line numbers area. The hint text is shown in tooltip of those icons. Note: This flag is only available if line numbers are shown.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getValue

returnValue.description: Value of property value

methods.description:
Gets current value of property value.

The value displayed in the code editor.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getValueSelection

returnValue.description: Value of property valueSelection

methods.description:
Gets current value of property valueSelection.

Sets whether the code is automatically selected if a value is set.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description:
Gets current value of property width.

The width of the code editor.

Default value is "100%".

methods.name: prettyPrint
methods.description:
Pretty-prints the content of the editor.

Note: Works well for PHP. For other editor types (modes), the content might not be formatted well. In such cases it is recommended to use your own formatting.

methods.name: setColorTheme

returnValue.description: Returns this to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sTheme
parameters.description: See property documentation for accepted values

methods.description: Sets the color theme of the code editor

methods.name: setEditable

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEditable
parameters.description: New value for property editable

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property editable.

Sets whether the code in the editor can be changed by the user.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sHeight
parameters.description: New value for property height

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property height.

The height of the code editor. A minimal height of 3rem will be applied in case the height is less than 20px.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setMaxLines

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iMaxLines
parameters.description: New value for property maxLines

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property maxLines.

Sets whether the editor height should auto expand to a maximum number of lines. After reaching the maximum number of lines specified, the content of the CodeEditor will become scrollable.

Note: Keep in mind that the auto expand CodeEditor behavior requires the height property to be set to auto.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 0.
